banner.text: We're going to make a pixel that wanders around the lightboard randomly leaving a trail of light
We need to store the position of the pixel using variables, open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
This variable will store the horizontal X position, change it to pixelX
We'll grab a number block for the position, open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change from 0 to 8 to place the pixel in the middle of the lightboard
Let's grab a second variable for the Y position Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
This variable will store the vertical Y position, change it to pixelY
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change from 0 to 5
We're making an animation so we'll need a loop, open the Control tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change from seconds to frames so it animates faster
Let's start turning on lights, open the lightboard tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
We want to turn specific lights on using our variables, open this tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Let's hook our variables up in the draw loop, open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Set the light at X variable to pixelX
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Set the light at Y variable to pixelY
Did you see how our light moved to the centre of the lightboard, 8 pixels from the left and 5 from the top, like our variables. Now let's make it move
Let's change our variables, open the Math tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change to pixelX
Wow it flew off the lightboard 👀, what happens if we use random values?
Open the Math tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
We only want to move small random amounts so change 0 to -1
Change 10 to 1
Now our pixel kinda wobbles about drawing a line, this is because -1 moves it to the left of the board and 1 to the right. Let's do the same to the Y axis
Open the Math tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change to pixelY
Open the Math tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change from 0 to -1
Change from 10 to 1
Cool now it wanders around the lightboard, try pressing the restart button a few times. Now let's add some color
We'll store the color in a variable too, open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change to hue
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Open the Color tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
We need to use hsv colors so we can make a raindow, change from rgb to hsv
Let's hook up our hue variable, open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change to hue
We've made it red but now let's use math to create a rainbow trail 🌈, open the Math tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
As we increase the hue variable our colors will cycle through the rainbow, change to hue
This looks great but sometimes it wanders off into nowhere, let's use another loop to reset the position
Open the Control tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
We'll reset it every 3 seconds so change this from 1 to 3
Now we'll clear the lightboard by turning the lights off, open this tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Open this tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
By resetting the variables we can move our wandering pixel back to the middle of the lightboard, open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change to pixelX
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change from 0 to 8 to centre our pixel again
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change to pixelY
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change from 0 to 5 to centre our pixel again
Now we're created a pixel that wanders about leaving a rainbow trail and a second loop that restarts the lightshow so we can sit back and enjoy it
